snippet: A gynecologist and her patient form a horrifyingly twisted connection in this batty, bloody Argentine melodrama.
keywords: subject: Movies;creative_works: The Attachment Diaries (Movie);persons: Diment, Valentin Javier;
headline.main: ‘The Attachment Diaries’ Review: Love, Sick
title: The Attachment Diaries
overview: Argentina, 1970s. A desperate young woman goes to a clinic to have a clandestine abortion. As her pregnancy is already through the fourth month, the doctor refuses. Instead, she proposes to sell the baby to one of her clients and offers to provide shelter in her house until the child is born. Their disturbed personalities will become intertwined in a strange and dangerous relationship.

snippet: Religion comes between two girls falling in love in the 1990s in this sweet coming-of-age film bathed in grunge hues.
keywords: subject: Movies;creative_works: You Can Live Forever (Movie);persons: Slutsky, Mark;persons: Watts, Sarah (Film Director);persons: O'Driscoll, Anwen;persons: Laporte, June (Actor);
headline.main: ‘You Can Live Forever’ Review: Do You Love Me Now?
title: You Can Live Forever
overview: When Jaime, a gay teenager, is sent to live in a community of Jehovah's Witnesses in small-town Quebec, she falls madly in love with a devout Witness girl. The two embark on an intense affair with consequences that will reshape the rest of their lives.

snippet: Rachael Leigh Cook stars in this bland rom-com as a travel executive exploring Vietnam and getting over a breakup.
keywords: subject: Movies;creative_works: A Tourist's Guide to Love (Movie);persons: Tsuchida, Steven;persons: Cook, Rachael Leigh;
headline.main: ‘A Tourist’s Guide to Love’ Review: A Wearyingly Familiar Trip
title: A Tourist’s Guide to Love
overview: After an unexpected break up, a travel executive accepts an assignment to go undercover and learn about the tourist industry in Vietnam. Along the way, she finds adventure and romance with her Vietnamese expat tour guide and they decide to hijack the tour bus in order to explore life and love off the beaten path.

snippet: A radiant Virginie Efira stars as a Parisian teacher who blissfully falls for a man and his 4-year-old daughter, complicating everyone’s lives.
keywords: subject: Movies;persons: Zlotowski, Rebecca;creative_works: Other People's Children (Movie);
headline.main: ‘Other People’s Children’ Review: True Romance
headline.print_headline: Intoxicating Love With a Sobering Turn
title: Other People’s Children
overview: Rachel loves her life, her students, her friends, her ex, her guitar lessons. When she falls in love with Ali, she grows close to his 4-year-old daughter, Leila. She tucks her in, looks after her, and loves her like a mother... which she isn’t. Not yet. Rachel is 40. The desire for a family of her own is growing stronger, and the clock is ticking. Is it too late?

snippet: A film adaptation of Taylor Jenkins Reid’s novel has potential for drama, but it stumbles on stock melodrama.
keywords: subject: Movies;persons: Bracey, Luke (1989- );persons: Liu, Simu;persons: Reid, Taylor Jenkins;persons: Soo, Phillipa;persons: Fickman, Andy;creative_works: One True Loves (Movie);
headline.main: ‘One True Loves’ Review: A Romance Lost at Sea
title: One True Loves
overview: Emma and Jesse are living the perfect life together, until Jesse disappears in a tragic helicopter crash on their first wedding anniversary. Four years later, Emma has found happiness again and is about to marry her best friend when Jesse resurfaces, turning her world upside down and leaving her torn between two great loves.
production_countries: Czech Republic, United States of America

snippet: There’s not much Lennon music heard in this doc about his affair with May Pang, and given how much Pang trashes his wife, Yoko Ono, it’s no surprise it was withheld.
keywords: subject: Documentary Films and Programs;creative_works: The Lost Weekend: A Love Story (Movie);persons: Pang, May;persons: Lennon, John;persons: Ono, Yoko;persons: Brandstein, Eve;persons: Kaufman, Richard S (Filmmaker);persons: Samuels, Stuart (Filmmaker);subject: Content Type: Personal Profile;subject: Pop and Rock Music;
headline.main: ‘The Lost Weekend: A Love Story’ Review: When John Lennon Strayed
headline.print_headline: The Lost Weekend:  A Love Story
title: The Lost Weekend: A Love Story
original_title: The Lost Weekend: A Love Story
overview: May Pang lovingly recounts her life in rock & roll and the whirlwind 18 months spent as friend, lover, and confidante to one of the towering figures of popular culture, John Lennon, in this funny, touching, and vibrant portrait of first love.

snippet: A mesmerizing Teyana Taylor stars in A.V. Rockwell’s feature directing debut, about motherhood and survival in a fast-changing city.
keywords: subject: Movies;creative_works: A Thousand and One (Movie);persons: Rockwell, AV (Film Director);persons: Taylor, Teyana (1990- );
headline.main: ‘A Thousand and One’ Review: A New York Love Story
headline.print_headline: An Unbending Will Meets a Shifting City
title: A Thousand and One
overview: Struggling but unapologetically living on her own terms, Inez is moving from shelter to shelter in mid-1990s New York City. With her 6-year-old son Terry in foster care and unable to leave him again, she kidnaps him so they can build their life together. As the years go by, their family grows and Terry becomes a smart yet quiet teenager, but the secret that has defined their lives threatens to destroy the home they have so improbably built.

snippet: This humdrum Netflix romantic comedy features Reese Witherspoon and Ashton Kutcher as longtime friends with possibly hidden feelings for each other.
keywords: subject: Movies;creative_works: Your Place or Mine (Movie);persons: Witherspoon, Reese;persons: Kutcher, Ashton;persons: McKenna, Aline Brosh;
headline.main: ‘Your Place or Mine’ Review: Try Neither
headline.print_headline: They Have a Humdrum Kind of Love
title: Your Place or Mine
overview: When best friends and total opposites Debbie and Peter swap homes for a week, they get a peek into each other's lives that could open the door to love.

snippet: To combat the overdose crisis, a group that includes former and current users open a safe consumption site where shooting up does not have to mean death.
keywords: subject: Documentary Films and Programs;subject: Fentanyl;subject: Drug Abuse and Traffic;subject: Volunteers and Community Service;creative_works: Love in the Time of Fentanyl (Movie);persons: Askey, Colin;glocations: Vancouver (British Columbia);organizations: Overdose Prevention Society;
headline.main: ‘Love in the Time of Fentanyl’ Review: Heartbreak, Death and Hope in Vancouver
headline.print_headline: Love in the Time Of Fentanyl
title: Love in the Time of Fentanyl
original_title: Love in the Time of Fentanyl
overview: An intimate portrait of a community fighting to save lives and keep hope alive in a neighborhood ravaged by the overdose crisis.

snippet: This documentary from Ryan White rewinds, to powerful effect, on Pamela Anderson’s life and fame.
keywords: subject: Documentary Films and Programs;persons: Anderson, Pamela (1967- );persons: White, Ryan (Filmmaker);creative_works: Pamela, a Love Story (Movie);
headline.main: ‘Pamela, a Love Story’ Review: A Frank Look Back
title: Pamela, a Love Story
overview: In her own words, through personal video and diaries, Pamela Anderson shares the story of her rise to fame, rocky romances and infamous sex tape scandal.

snippet: In Matt Carter’s gay rugby film, sports and romance smash together like two players from opposing teams.
keywords: subject: Movies;creative_works: In From the Side (Movie);persons: Carter, Matt (Filmmaker);
headline.main: ‘In From the Side’ Review: Love and Rugby Play a Losing Game
title: In From the Side
overview: Mark, a new and inexperienced rugby club member, finds himself drawn to Warren, a seasoned first team player. When a series of happenstances at an away fixture lead to a drunken encounter, Mark and Warren unwittingly embark on a romantic affair they struggle to hide from their partners and teammates.

snippet: In this intelligent melodrama by the director Aleem Khan, a British woman discovers her husband has been leading a double life.
keywords: subject: Movies;creative_works: After Love (2020) (Movie);persons: Khan, Aleem;persons: Scanlan, Joanna (1961- );
headline.main: ‘After Love’ Review: The Other Woman
title: After Love
overview: Set in the port town of Dover in the South-East of England, Mary Hussain suddenly finds herself a widow following the unexpected death of her husband. A day after the burial, she discovers he has a secret just twenty-one miles across the English Channel in Calais.

snippet: In this naturalistic drama from Spain, a family confronts the impending loss of its generations-old farm.
keywords: subject: Movies;persons: Simon, Carla;creative_works: Alcarras (Movie);
headline.main: ‘Alcarràs’ Review: Labor of Love
title: Alcarràs
overview: In a small village in Catalonia, the peach farmers of the Solé family spend every summer together picking fruit from their orchard. But when plans arise to install solar panels and cut down trees, the members of this tight-knit group suddenly face eviction – and the loss of far more than their home.

snippet: A family archive provides intimate records of a love affair that began between two women imprisoned in the Ravensbrück concentration camp.
keywords: subject: Documentary Films and Programs;persons: Gertten, Magnus;creative_works: Nelly & Nadine (Movie);subject: Content Type: Personal Profile;subject: Holocaust and the Nazi Era;subject: World War II (1939-45);subject: Women and Girls;subject: Homosexuality and Bisexuality;
headline.main: ‘Nelly & Nadine’ Review: An Unlikely Love, an Unlikely Record
title: Nelly & Nadine
original_title: Nelly Knows Mysteries: A Fatal Engagement
overview: When an unusual handwritten letter arrives at Nelly’s office, she identifies the handwriting as belonging to her childhood friend Dahlia, claiming her boyfriend Blake is being unfaithful. Determined to help, Nelly wants some answers and rushes to Blake’s home only to find his dead body. When Dahlia becomes the prime suspect, the new, handsome Detective in town, Michael Hogan must work with Nelly to prove that her childhood friend is not the killer everyone believes her to be.

snippet: The new Netflix adaptation of D.H. Lawrence’s once-controversial novel is both steamy and decorous.
keywords: subject: Movies;creative_works: Lady Chatterley's Lover (Movie);persons: Corrin, Emma (1995- );persons: De Clermont-Tonnerre, Laure;persons: Lawrence, D H;
headline.main: ‘Lady Chatterley’s Lover’ Review: When Connie Met Ollie
headline.print_headline: A Love Whose Name Is Often Spoken
title: Lady Chatterley’s Lover
overview: Unhappily married aristocrat Lady Chatterley begins a torrid affair — and falls deeply in love — with the gamekeeper on her husband's country estate.
production_countries: United Kingdom, United States of America

snippet: A young singer gets more than she bargained for when she accepts a job as a nanny for a billionaire’s children.
keywords: subject: Movies;persons: Ne-Yo;creative_works: The Sound of Christmas (Movie);persons: Mattison, Booker T;persons: McNeill, Serayah;
headline.main: ‘The Sound of Christmas’ Review: A Gospel Singer Finds Love
title: The Sound of Christmas
overview: A woman facing eviction just before Christmas who must navigate budding romantic feelings for a handsome billionaire when she takes a job nannying for his two children right before Christmas.

snippet: Elegance Bratton’s autobiographical first feature is a lyrical, wrenching look at a young Marine’s journey through basic training.
keywords: subject: Movies;creative_works: The Inspection (Movie);persons: Bratton, Elegance;
headline.main: ‘The Inspection’ Review: Boot Camp, a Love Story
headline.print_headline: A Few Good Men, Some With Secrets
title: The Inspection
overview: Ellis French is a young, gay Black man, rejected by his mother and with few options for his future, decides to join the Marines, doing whatever it takes to succeed in a system that would cast him aside. But even as he battles deep-seated prejudice and the grueling routines of basic training, he finds unexpected camaraderie, strength, and support in this new community, giving him a hard-earned sense of belonging that will shape his identity and forever change his life.

snippet: Luca Guadagnino’s latest stars Timothée Chalamet and Taylor Russell as young cannibals on the run.
keywords: subject: Movies;creative_works: Bones and All (Movie);persons: Guadagnino, Luca;persons: Chalamet, Timothee (1995- );persons: Russell, Taylor (1994- );
headline.main: ‘Bones and All’ Review: You Eat What You Are
headline.print_headline: It’s Eat, Prey, Love on a Journey of Self-Discovery
title: Bones and All
overview: Abandoned by her father, a young woman embarks on a thousand-mile odyssey through the backroads of America where she meets a disenfranchised drifter. But despite their best efforts, all roads lead back to their terrifying pasts and to a final stand that will determine whether their love can survive their otherness.

snippet: A schoolteacher, her police officer husband and his lover deny each other romantic satisfaction in this dismal melodrama.
keywords: subject: Movies;creative_works: My Policeman (Movie);persons: Grandage, Michael;
headline.main: ‘My Policeman’ Review: Two Love Affairs, Equally Tragic
title: My Policeman
overview: In the late 1990s, the arrival of elderly invalid Patrick into Marion and Tom’s home triggers the exploration of seismic events from 40 years previous: the passionate relationship between Tom and Patrick at a time when homosexuality was illegal.
production_countries: United Kingdom, United States of America

snippet: Thomas Mann’s beguiling performance drives this Emma Roberts vehicle, but the romantic comedy creaks under the weight of its coincidences.
keywords: subject: Movies;creative_works: About Fate (Movie);persons: Vaysberg, Marius;persons: Mann, Thomas (1991- );persons: Roberts, Emma (1991- );
headline.main: ‘About Fate’ Review: Love the One You’re With?
title: About Fate
overview: Two strangers believe in love but never seem to be able to find its true meaning. In a wild twist of events, fate puts each in the other's path on one stormy New Year's Eve.

snippet: Set in Paris in the 1960s, the film tells the story of two irrepressible lovers, and their young son, whose tale turns tragic.
keywords: subject: Movies;persons: Bourdeaut, Olivier;creative_works: Waiting for Bojangles (Movie);persons: Roinsard, Regis;
headline.main: ‘Waiting for Bojangles’ Review: Endless Love
title: Waiting for Bojangles
overview: A boy and his eccentric parents leave their home in Paris for a country house in Spain. As the mother descends deeper into her own mind, it's up to the boy and his father to keep her safe and happy.

snippet: This comedy is a daddy-issues movie with a queasy premise truly made for these times.
keywords: subject: Movies;persons: Oswalt, Patton;creative_works: I Love My Dad (Movie);persons: Morosini, James;
headline.main: ‘I Love My Dad’ Review: A Father Catfishes His Son
headline.print_headline: A Father Catfishes His Son. We Just Wait for the Ick.
title: I Love My Dad
overview: A hopelessly estranged father catfishes his son in an attempt to reconnect.

snippet: Two former childhood friends rekindle their connection in this sweetly hopeful story of romantic longing.
keywords: subject: Movies;creative_works: A Love Song (Movie);persons: Walker-Silverman, Max;persons: Dickey, Dale (Actor);persons: STUDI, WES;
headline.main: ‘A Love Song’ Review: When Moving Forward Means Looking Back
headline.print_headline: The Romantic Ache That Never Truly Dies
title: A Love Song
overview: Two childhood sweethearts, now both widowed, share a night by a lake in the mountains.

snippet: Katie Holmes writes, directs and stars in this minor-key rom-com set in 2020.
keywords: subject: Movies;persons: Holmes, Katie;creative_works: Alone Together (Movie);
headline.main: ‘Alone Together’ Review: Finding Love in a Pandemic Retreat
title: Alone Together
overview: Strangers June and Charlie wind up double-booked in the same upstate New York Airbnb during the start of COVID-19. Exasperating the situation, the lockdown forces them both to stay and confront the unexpected feelings that develop between them.

snippet: A disillusioned college professor develops a relationship with a young Chinese woman, in a familiar and worn-out narrative.
keywords: subject: Movies;creative_works: Art of Love (Movie);persons: Kaplan, Betty (Film Director);
headline.main: ‘Art of Love’ Review: An Erotic Male Fantasy in Puerto Rico
title: Art of Love
overview: After learning that the art thief she has been chasing is her ex-lover, an officer working for Interpol concocts a plan to catch him red-handed.

snippet: In this marriage drama, a young couple heads to the countryside to break out of a toxic cycle.
keywords: subject: Movies;creative_works: The Wheel (Movie);persons: Pink, Steve;
headline.main: ‘The Wheel’ Review: Songs of Love and Hate
title: The Wheel
overview: Sometime in the near future, paraplegic prison inmate Matt Mills meets "The Board" of Satoshi-Telefair Industries, who thank him for joining the Program. Under pressure and with a promise to make him walk again, Mills agrees to volunteer. He is injected with a synthetic nanomaterial and suffocated, only to wake up with restored use of his legs, yet alone in a steel cell in the first spoke of an experimental apparatus - The Wheel. A series of assailants inflict a multitude of damage to Mills' body and torment his mind, yet the synthetic nanomaterial not only restores his damaged organs, it re-engineers his strength. The experiment might be designed to kill, but Mills is determined to survive - and get back to his daughter before The Board finds her first.

snippet: The director Taika Waititi injects antic silliness, once again, into this Marvel franchise starring Chris Hemsworth, who swings a mighty hammer and flexes mightier muscles.
keywords: subject: Movies;organizations: Marvel Studios;persons: Bale, Christian;persons: Crowe, Russell;persons: Hemsworth, Chris;persons: Waititi, Taika;persons: Thompson, Tessa;persons: Portman, Natalie;
headline.main: ‘Thor: Love and Thunder’ Review: A God’s Comic Twilight
headline.print_headline: He’s Still a Norse God, But Also a Big Old Goof
title: Thor: Love and Thunder
overview: After his retirement is interrupted by Gorr the God Butcher, a galactic killer who seeks the extinction of the gods, Thor Odinson enlists the help of King Valkyrie, Korg, and ex-girlfriend Jane Foster, who now wields Mjolnir as the Mighty Thor. Together they embark upon a harrowing cosmic adventure to uncover the mystery of the God Butcher’s vengeance and stop him before it’s too late.

snippet: In the latest film from Claire Denis, Juliette Binoche plays a Parisian radio journalist in a romantic quandary.
keywords: subject: Movies;persons: Denis, Claire;persons: Binoche, Juliette;persons: Lindon, Vincent;creative_works: Both Sides of the Blade (Movie);
headline.main: ‘Both Sides of the Blade’ Review: Who Do You Love?
headline.print_headline: A Bliss Doomed To Be Doused
title: Both Sides of the Blade
overview: Jean and Sara have been living together for 10 years. When they first met, Sara was living with François, Jean’s best friend and an admirer from back when he played rugby. Jean and Sara love each other. One day, Sara sees François in the street. He does not notice her, but she is overtaken by the sensation that her life could suddenly change. François gets back in touch with Jean. For the first time in years. He suggests they start working together again. From here on, things spiral out of control.

snippet: Sara Dosa’s new documentary chronicles the lives and deaths of the French scientists Katia and Maurice Krafft.
keywords: subject: Documentary Films and Programs;subject: Volcanoes;creative_works: Fire of Love (Movie);subject: Content Type: Personal Profile;subject: Deaths (Fatalities);persons: Dosa, Sara;persons: Krafft, Maurice (1946-91);persons: Krafft, Katia (1942-91);
headline.main: ‘Fire of Love’ Review: A Volcanic Romance
title: Fire of Love
overview: A doomed love triangle between intrepid French scientists Katia and Maurice Krafft, and their beloved volcanoes.
